casebody.data:
Anonymous. ON CEETIOEAEI. If the plaintiff discharges the defendant from arrest on a warrant, upon the defendants promising to appear heforo the justice, and the defendant does not appear, and the plaintiff takes judgment in his absence, the judgment will be reversed. *146The plaintiff in certiorari, who was the defendant below, was arrested on a warrant from a justice of the peace. The plaintiff below told the defendant he might go at large, upon his promising to appear before the justice, on a certain day, to answer the plaintiff’s demand. The defendant did not appear before the justice according to his agreement, and the plaintiff took judgment against-him in his absence. « Jeffers,

now moved to reverse this j udgment.

Per Curiam.

The permitting the defendant to go at large, upon his promise to appear, was essentially a discharge. There never was any appearance to the action, therefore,

Let judgment be reversed.
